title: Issues updating to 6.16
body:
Whenever I open the game now I get a window stating unspecified error and that the update has failed. It also says to check the logs for more information but I don't know how to do that.

Any ideas?

replies.body: The patcher can have different issues depending on when it's crashing.  At what percent are you receiving this error, and do you have any screenshots?  Happy to help with more info!

I would screenshot it but I suck too much at figuring out where the screenshot went.

Anyway, it happens as soon as I open the client. The bar up top hits 33% automatically and then goes to 0% and that error pops up.

> [{quoted}](name=Riddlér,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=fvr16Mw4,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-08-12T23:41:35.398+0000)
>
> I would screenshot it but I suck too much at figuring out where the screenshot went.
> 
> Anyway, it happens as soon as I open the client. The bar up top hits 33% automatically and then goes to 0% and that error pops up.

Hey! We were having the same issues and now mine is fixed! So i thought that maybe what I did could also work for you. I updated to the latest version of Windows 10 and turned off Windows Firewall as I was advised to. After that it still did the same, but then I just stopped trying to update it for at least an hour. When I tried it again now it began to actually scan files and update all the way (still going straight to 33% at first)  It actually patched faster than ever before! I hope this helps you as it did for me :)

At 33%, your patcher is trying to maintain a connection to download updates.  Having an error here can suggest a problem with your network, so let's get that fixed up.  I suggest going over our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide for a series of steps towards getting this resolved.  Let me know if you have any questions!

I tried all the things with the connection and it still happens. I waited a day just to see if my system needed a break or something but it is still happening. 

I have Windows 7 btw. 

Any other ideas?
